er 30, 2012
												Grand Theft Auto San Andreas is what I consider the best of the series. I am constantly surprised Rockstar managed to put this game on the PS2. It features a massive open world, with a simply sublime soundtrack and cast of characters. The gameplay was far more dynamic then it's predecessor. With being able to climb walls, to having a parachute, to finding a jetpack and doing drive by shootings from 50 feet in the air.San Andreas was just as amazing when it first came out as it is today. Almost every modern sandbox game takes leaps and bounds that Rockstar first carved in 2004. If you only buy one Grand Theft Auto game, buy this one. You will definately not regret, nor forget, San Andreas.

content:
r 3, 2016
												CJ returns to Los Santos after spending five years living in Liberty City when his brother Sweet calls to inform him of their mother's murder. Shortly after leaving the airport, CJ is intercepted by a group of corrupt officers from the Los Santos Police Department (LSPD) Community Resources Against Street Hoodlums (CRASH) division led by Frank Tenpenny, and followed by Officers Eddie Pulaski and Jimmy Hernandez, with whom CJ has a history. Tenpenny implicates CJ in the murder of a police officer named Pendlebury, that Tenpenny himself committed, as he was on the verge of exposing him to Internal Affairs, and threatens to frame him for it if he does not co-operate with them. CJ returns to his former home on Grove Street and reunites with his brother Sweet, sister Kendl and members of his old gang, Big Smoke and Ryder. Finding that the Grove Street Families (GSF) have lost much of their territory while he was gone, CJ decides to stay in town. Working with the others to re-establish the GSF, CJ gradually restores the gang to power, allying himself with Kendl's boyfriend, Cesar Vialpando, leader of the Varrios Los Aztecas, and together they drive off the rival Ballas and Vagos gangs, reducing the amount of drugs on the streets. In doing so, CJ regains the respect of Sweet, who was disappointed that he had left Grove Street after the death of their brother, Brian. While en route to join Sweet for a showdown against the Ballas, CJ is called by Cesar, who tells him to meet with him outside a garage where they witness Smoke and Ryder meeting with Tenpenny and a group of Ballas, learning that they had been working with Tenpenny all along, and were responsible for his mother's murder. Suspecting a set-up, CJ rushes to Sweet's aid, who was wounded in the ambush, and fights off the Ballas, but the police arrive shortly afterward. Sweet is imprisoned while Tenpenny takes CJ into the countryside and dumps him there. With the GSF in shambles, Smoke and Ryder, now openly allied with the Ballas.

												GTA: San Andreas.. A game that opened up a lot of enjoyable and memorable moments. I remember being by the coast and a blonde woman in roller skates flying past me saying "I'm so thick that I can ♥♥♥♥", I cried away at this for quite a while and never forgot it. This game exposed what was supposed to be the life of a drug dealer and the struggles that came for Carl Johnson. Playing this on the PS2 was great simply because I would have one of my friends play with me, the coop was a great idea which I loved after playing this alone which would get pretty boring. The missions were very fun and exciting; moments of rage were present very frequently when I failed.

content:
11, 2016
												All this time, years and years after being released onto this world, San Andreas has remained one of the best GTA games ever to be made. Compared to the present ones, yeah, it lacks graphics, that's the only flaw it really has.   So, you are a black man - Not being racist here - And your life is just... awful, care to make it better? This game is all about it, making someone's life better. You start has a lowlife gangbanging balla killing machine.. and at the end? The exact same thing, but rich, the whole city is at your feet.  In my opinion, this game makes me feel great, riding bikes on the desert at extremely high speeds, jumping off a plane without a parachute, hearing Cj's remarkable comments everytime.. pure comedy. Besides, having a mature and dark story, if you are willing to hear it, the surreal experience makes you feel part of it.   This game is old, hell yeah it is, but so is your mom.. and you still love her don't you? That's what i fell, it has everything GTA V has, except great graphics and online gameplay. You can steal houses here, buy ridiculously expensive massions, make great cars (Racing Ones), participate in lowrider events, races... or even, just parking your car somewhere, doesn't matter where really, and listen to the music this game has.. (+ adding your own to the game) At the end of the day, to me, this game beats GTA V - 100/0- No doubts. Wanna know why? Groove is Life ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

												Phenomenal open-world sandbox. Great gameplay with a variety of missions and things to do, an excellent story that knows when to be serious and when to be funny, and a phenomenal radio setlist that really captures the feel of the early '90s. However, you're better off pirating it or playing it on a PS2 emulator because of the patch Rockstar put in that removed a bunch of songs from the in-game radio (they took out Killing in the Name and Hellraiser, would not buy), removed resolution options, and broke everybody's saves. Or you could just buy it on steam and download the unofficial patch that fixes the the game and the stuff Rockstar removed, but that would mean giving them money.

content:
14, 2014
												Given the wonderful environment design, new RPG elements, and extremely well done "gangsta" theme, Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas comes as close to perfect as anything could.Sure, the instant replay feature was left out, but this is a mostly untouched Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas, one of the best games ever made, and now a version of it can be played on the PC with the best controls and graphics available.The soundtrack is inspired, with a heavy emphasis on late-'8s/early '90s rap and alternative rock. What does make it great is that it actually delivers on nearly everything it promises while still being fun to just pick up and play.

number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful
content:
24, 2014
												I thought i would never give a game a 10/10. I was wrong.Grand Theft Auto San Andreas is a game that separates itself from all others. San Andreas' combination of a great story, great game play and much more is why.Story - 10/10I think the story is very good. You are Carl Johnson. You are coming back from Liberty City because you got a call from your brother Sweet saying your mother just died. All this crazy stuff happens. Its great and really sucks you in. You will want more when you finish the game.Graphics - 8/10The graphics are average at best, but the animations are great. The rest of the game makes up for the graphics.Sound - 10/10The sound in the game is phenomenal. There are many radio stations with a huge variety of music. You can even have a custom radio station with your own tracks! The sound affects are perfect. The voice acting is even BETTER than perfect! Young Maylay completely nails his voice acting role of Carl Johnson (The main character in Grand Theft Auto San Andreas).Controls - 9.6/10The controls are great. It can be confusing at first, but you will get used to them very quickly. If you are used to playing the PS2 version of Grand Theft Auto San Andreas, you can buy a PS2 to PC converter so you can use the PS2 controller with Grand Theft Auto San Andreas for the PC. Game play - 10/10Wow. Simply wow. Playing this game is so much fun. I just can't get enough of San Andreas. I still play it today. You will be playing it forever. There is so much to do. You can do missions, destroy crap, dating a girl friend and MUCH, MUCH, MUCH more! I am so amazed at how much fun this game is!Bonus Features/Mods - 10/10After you beat Grand Theft Auto San Andreas, you will still be playing for months, maybe even years like me! You can download mods like a Bigfoot mod, car mods, and all kinds of mods! You can do anything you want after you finish the game. My favorite thing to do after beating the game is searching for Easter eggs and myths. San Andreas is full of them!Final Score - 10/10Simply put. This is the greatest game ever made. Props to Rock Star for making such a amazing game! BUY THIS GAME NOW!

content:
14, 2016
												I am playing the GTA serie one after the other.Finished GTA III and Vice City. (see my reviews)What's different / new compared to Vice City (VC)Same like VC1) Overview map : Can be accessed via the game menu, in addition to VC you can add a marker.Still the lack of a hotkey 'M' for direct map access.....because it is a console port.2) Cash income : slow so you are 'forced' to do side missions. Later in the game, you haveaccess to race missions and can export cars at the harbor which are really helpfull in cash generation.3) Buying properties and as such having a save point or an asset (cash generation)4) Weaponry : +/- same, in addition knife or silenced pistol for stealth.5) Music score : Same quality which means superb, choice for everyone....rock, hip-hop, rap, alternative, country.6) pop-ups of cars and buildings even at high drawing distance settings7) frame limiter needs to be set 'on' just like VC and GTAIII to avoid strange physics of cars.Better then VC1) Windows 10 : Unlike VC and GTA III, i didn't need to apply the Silent patch to run the game smoothly.2) Map size : hughhhh, three cities connected with green land, mountains and local villages.Each city has it's own typical lay-out with references to Las Vegas - San Francisco - Los Angeles3) New vehicles : bike, truck, train, tractor, harvester, buggy, go-cart4) Besides the story line missions, there are plenty of side missions. The classic ones like ambulance driving, be a fire fighter, playing the cop and chase criminals, find hidden collectibles, do unique stunt jumps, start illegal races but also newones like driving a truck, going back to school (bike - plane - car - boat), playing the burglar, driving a freight train, dance with the low rider car, ......5) Graphics, it is not a major jump forward but people can walk (no zombie walk), Anti-liasing can be turned on and there are blur effects to mimic hot weather or fast speed during racing.6) Like barbie or Ken, you can 'modify' CJ with tattoos, shoes, trousers, hair style for improvinghis sex appeal and attract women's attention.7) If you train or just by playing, you will get better in shooting, driving, fighting, swimming etc.8) In-game references to previous games like pictures of Candy SUxxx and Love Fist, the appearance of characters of GTAIII and Vice City which is fun. Certainly the Britisch lads.9) Police and passengers are more agressive.10) In VC and GTAIII, water is deadly, in SA you can swim and dive.11) No screen loadingsLess then VC1) Story line : somehow pointless, neccessary to make connections between missions but that's it, VC is simply better.2) Main character CJ : Errand boy.... dull character compared to Antonio Vercetti (VC)3) NPC's : some SA-characters are nerve cracking and very childish -> Catalina, The Truth and OG Loc4) Humour (characters and radio stations): less refined.5) Flying a plane (not heli) with mouse and keyboard is horrible. For finishing the main game, one needs to finish the flight school and that is really painfull and frustating.Overall it is a good game don't get me wrong but it has it's flaws.The proper balance between quantity versus quaility.Vice City is smaller (David vs Golliath) and offers less play time, but beats San Andreas when it comes to story, characters and humour.Now, it is time to move on to GTA 4 (which has it's installation issues)

												Game itself is great, don't get me wrong on that. The reason why I'm not recommending this is because the PC port is dreadful. The mouse is automatically inverted(not a problem really, just an opinion), other than that I get about 20 FPS average with V-sync on with my GTX 760, I get better performance on watch_dogs with V-sync on. The part that really gets me about the PC port is when you change some of the mouse settings, the mouse automatically freezes when you're in-game so you can't look around until you reset the settings to default. The mouse sensitivity is horrible, even with the lowest mouse sensitivity possible and turning my gaming mouse down to the lowest DPI possible it was still very sensitive. Really wanted to enjoy this game but the PC port isn't all that good.

												Back when the game first came out for PlayStation 2 I quickly fell in love with it, it felt so revolutionary.. the amount of freedom and the variety of content completely blew my teenage mind. I remember waking up early in the morning booting up my console and spend entire weekends alone and with friends, just messing around, using cheats, and myth hunting on the local multiplayer.So a few years later when I first bought a computer, I re-purchased this game to reminisce the good old days, that was when I discovered modding for the very first time, I remember spending countless hours a day just fiddling with the game files, so it felt like a completely new experience every time I played. Ever since then, I've beat the storyline a total of 22 times on both platforms, and I've been playing this game for almost 10 years now... I don't think I will ever experience something like this in my lifetime ever again.This game will forever be remembered by me as the pinnacle of the Grand Theft Auto franchise.(Re-write pending)

5, 2016
												You start as CJ, a black male who is coming back to the hood to defeat rival gangs and doing missions for your homies. You are able to drive bikes, vehicles, boats, planes, etc. You can collect many things to unlock secrets. A lot of missions that needs to be solved, even sidequests like car races, etc. With many mods from the internet you can modifier this game to the maximum. It seems like you can play San Andreas on Multiplayer Mode, i saw a guide on steam about this feature, but im not sure if it's working. But even without the feature, there is a lot to do or things to have fun with. Why u should buy it:-The main characters are talking like gangsters and insulting each other, very cool atmosphere (not like GTA3 were Claude isn't speaking a single word). -You are able to swim and climb over lower walls.-You can do sidequests missions like police, medic or firefighter which rewards you with secrets.-Many things to collect, like 100x graffiti tags, 50x horseshoes, 50x oysters, 50x snapshots.-Rival Gang Territorial Fights, defending or conquering rival gang territorials.-You are able to buy houses/properties so you are having more savegame houses or garages for your vehicles.-Monster Stuns or burglary missions.-You can dress your character individual with new clothes or accessiores, you even get new haircuts.-Tuning your car with new spoilers or body kits and fill it with nitro/nos so you can drive like a boss through San Andreas.-Many things more i just forgot... ;)This game is a must have buy, it's still the best GTA game in my Opinion.

content:
ry 16, 2016
												One of my biggest pet peeves is when people complain about how hard the mission 'wrong side of the tracks' is. There is a reason why it's one of the first missions in the game people, just keep up with the train, don't crash the bike and you will beat it. JUST FOLLOW THE TRAIN CJ. Thats my little rant aside, this is hands down the best GTA of all time in my opinion. Just the size of the world and the variety of missions alone make it the best. Missions like you driving a bike into a plane before it takes off, blowing up the plane and then jumping out with a parachute. Stealing a plane, jumping out the plane into another plane, killing everyone in the plane then flying that plane back to the airport.Sneaking into a military base, killing everyone there once you're inside, stealing a jetpack and escaping the base by flying out of there using the jetpack while choopers and planes are on your a*s trying to shoot you down. The casino robbery and the final mission, there are so many others like that i could go on forever. It also has the best story in the series in my opinion as well as the best characters like big smoke, ryder, catalina, mike toreno, tenpenny, woozie etc. And the length of the game as well and all the side missions and activities is crazy even though i can beat the game fairly quickly now because i played through it so many times. A first time playthrough will take you around 30 hours. I also have to mention the amazing soundtrack and radio stations its great stuff. This is more of a love letter then a review, its one of my favourite games of all time.10/10 (Masterpiece)

												Hmm, depends what you mean by "reccomend," as to what my answer would be.Firstly, I got this as a free D/L with GTA V (pre-order) so, it was free. However, I had the non-steam (retail disk) version a few years back, so thought it would be fun to relive the old days, before GTA V came out. The game is crappy now. It is poorly optimised, most of the songs I remember are gone, and the resolution is very low, even on its highest settings. I thought this was perculiar, as the resolution was great, when I first got the game in 2010/2011. Having done some research, I found out that R* patched the game, to the point where it was essentially a port of the MOBILE game. This dissapointed me greatly. In conclusion, no, I don't reccomend this. If you got it free with GTA V, its okay, because it's free. However, don't buy this on it's own.Really, my honest opinion is, if you want to play this game, torrent it. This gives you the genuine experience of what the game was intended to be upon release. However, if you don't want to break the law, GTA V is my answer.

content:
, 2016
												Ok. This game is absolutely amazing in every way possible. I just wanted to get this out of the way right here:Here are the specs of my PC:Processor: Intel Pentium CPU: B980 @ 2.40GHz RAM: 4GB Operating System: Windows 10 Type: 64-bit operating system x64-based processor Graphics Card: Intel HD GraphicsAnd guess what? I'm getting over 100FPS! This game is well optimized, and has a great story. There is so much you can do on the PC version that you can't do on the PS2/XB versions. Amazing mod support, great story, great gameplay, and good graphics and frame rate for a terrible PC like mine! Even though I'm running the game at low graphics, you can't even tell a difference.The game's story is very long, but it's so open-world, that it feels like San Andreas is just as big as the GTA V version of Los Santos. I also noticed that this game along with a couple other GTA games has gore in it, which makes it a little more graphic. I'm totally ok with it too, just thought I'd bring it up.The gameplay mechanics are a little different than the PS2/XB versions of the game. There's no auto aim on PC (unless if you play with the controller mod), but PC gaming is really advanced and I understand why they don't have auto aim for mice. It'll be really easy to get a shot with auto aim if your playing on PC. I also know that the PC version is missing a cheat code from the console version, and there are a few changes to the environment, because the console version and the PC version are not exactly the same either. It's alright though.I'll give this a 9/10, and here is my list of PROS and CONS on the PC version:PROS:Great mod supportGreat storyGreat gameplayGreat performance/optimizationOPEN WORLD BABY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! (Well, that should go under gameplay)And it actually works on bad PC's!CONS:Missing cheat codeEnviromental changes between PC and consoleSlight gameplay mechanic changesBad controller support (you have to use the controller mod to have good controller support)No intro at the beginning of the game (for me at least, I don't know about other people)Well, this is my review for Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas on the PC. I love it, and I'd play it any day.

												Hmm, depends what you mean by "reccomend," as to what my answer would be.Firstly, I got this as a free D/L with GTA V (pre-order) so, it was free. However, I had the non-steam (retail disk) version a few years back, so thought it would be fun to relive the old days, before GTA V came out. The game is crappy now. In conclusion, no, I don't reccomend this. If you got it free with GTA V, its okay, because it's free. However, don't buy this on it's own.Really, my honest opinion is, if you want to play this game, torrent it. This gives you the genuine experience of what the game was intended to be upon release. However, if you don't want to break the law, GTA V is my answer.

content:
13, 2014
												Ahhhh, the classic Grand Theft Auto Series, so many good memories of this game, from younge and old... this game was a staple of the GTA series often said to be the BEST GTA in the whole series. So let me go over the Pros and Cons.Pros:- LONG Story MANY hours will go into this game and most will not be Regretted.- The Game has a HUUUUUUUGE map to explore, and find the oh so many secrets.- The Customization of your character is almost infinite, with so MANY different variaties to choose from you could deck out your character as much as you'd like.-SO many cars to choose from, including Bicycles and and Motorcycles, most cars able to be customized and outfitted.-Your character can learn different fighting styles as he travles, making him versatile in brawls.-You can Swim, HOLY CRAP a Grown man who can swim.-You can recruit grang members into a posse, and do drive bys or have massive gun fights.-You can claim territory and have massive gang wars with the 3 other Opposing gangs.-SO MANY weapons to pick from, including Assualt Rifles, SMGs, Pistols.-Many shop interirors and building interiors to check out and see.-Many Secret Interiors and other Secrets around the world, for you to explore and find.-Its made by Rockstar I mean COME on Rockstar games is BAD ♥♥♥.-Lag is non-exsistant.-Nice Musical pieces on all Radio Stations, and a few Radio Talkshows have some funny dialogue.-The game isn't too easy or too hard, some missions being SUPER easy, while some will be a challenge.Cons:-Graphics are not exactly the best.-Controls on PC can be confusing (Especially for thoese of Us who played it on PS2)-The save feature in this game, is annoying. (You have to drive ALL the way back to a home you own JUST to save.)-The Music and Speech in the game, can often feel repetitive and just plain boring.-Missions have NO checkpoints, so if you die YOU have to do that mission ALL over again.-Modding is hard to do in this game.Would I recommend this game? Yes, I would infact i'd recommend it to anyone whos already played the game, or IS completely new to Rockstar Games, or the GTA franchise. The game is overall one of the few games I play, that don't require mods to BE fun or MORE fun.

content:
, 2016
												My Opinion About The Game (Without Story Spoilers) : Grand Theft Auto : San Andreas is an Open World TPS made and published by Rockstar Studios . I probaby don't need to intouduce you to the series. I didn't play Vice City (I will and when I did I'll delete this part of the review) and all the others before that but I played all the others after this one. For me it seems like this one has the biggest world that you can actually go to. Like I said I didn' played the other games before this one (yet) but I think this has the best story out of all of them. I like all of them though. The only con I can think of this game considering it's age are the flying tutorials and missions they are awful hard. You can say that I'm a noob but I've seen a lot of people having the same problem. So I recommend playing atleast that part of the game with a controller but overall I recommend a controller for the game because of the vehicles. There's a small negative part of the game which is small because it doesn't  happen if you do this like I say , there's a part of the game where you have to take over territories . And theres a small territory named Jefferson Motel. That territory is so small that enemy gang members doesn't spawn there , so you need to lure them from other territories nearby. But if you took over all the territories except that one you gonna have a hard time capturing it. So I recomend capturing that one first. There are other negatives  which I did a researc on when I noticed the same things which  are regarding the Steam version not the game itself. Rockstar added a patch to the game which removed songs , option for changing resoultions and something with SAMP isn't right either . I played the crack GTA SA with SAMP and it barely had crashes but with the Steam version it crashes at least 1 time in 1 hour but usually around 2-3 times. And they messed up people's saves but that didn't affect me because I got the game after that. I completed the game's story 100%  all the missions all the territories all the stats like Respect , Stamina , Muscle theese kind of things , schools etc. I really like the game's story I like the characters I like that I don't have to go to bowling in every second. If you have Windows 8.1 or Windows 10 and SAMP doesn't start properly run Steam in administrator mode and set both GTA SA and samp exe to run in Windows SP3 (on Windows 8.1) , Windows 98 (on Windows 10)  and both in administrator mode. This made the multiplayer worked even tho you still gonna have crashes because of the crappy port.Graphics : 9 (The game came out in 2005)Audio : 9 (The Steam version itself would be 7 because of the removal of some songs)Gameplay : 10 (If you want to play SAMP on the Steam version you gonna have a hard time and I don't even know about what's up with the modding in it , considering GTA V's status on that)Story : 9 Replayability : 8 (8 because of the hell in the flying missions)Value : 6 (7 If you only buy it for the Single Player )Overall I recommend the game mainly if you only want to play in single player or if you don't mind a lot of crashes then multiplayer too. Well I wouldn't complain much about it after the GTA IV port. Enjoy the game !

content:
22, 2011
												This game is an accurate representation of Grandpa's childhood, growing up in the 50's was hard. We didn't have fancy things like watches and roads, we had gravel and pavement and we liked it. There were no black people, because they lived underground and so this game couldn't exist then.I enjoy this game, because it has black people in it, just like my favorite movie Friday. I love when they say ♥♥♥♥♥♥ alot, it reminds me of my father, when I was a kid. Back then dad would take us to what the whites called "♥♥♥♥♥♥ Races" it was where a bunch of black gentlemen would be gathered and your great grandpa would bet on which one would win the race. We never won, but boy were those good memories. Anyways, this game gets a 9.5/10 because it reminds Grandpa of the early days of black rights and privelleges. (Note: Grandpa is very old and of a different time, if you are of african american descent please don't take offense ~ Billy)

content:
er 1, 2014
												In October San Andreas became 10 years old. I replayed it because of nostalgia and I was shockingly surprised to see that a big part of its soundtrack was removed (18 songs = 11% of the total number of songs if my information is correct). And I felt it while progressing through the game. Towards the end I was flipping radio channels to get a song I haven't heard that much and it was becoming increasingly difficult to do so.Even though I enjoyed it, I can't recommend it. Not like this. This recent patch which did more damage than improvements (the game crashed a few times for me but usually it ran ok). If you want an old school GTA game, get Vice City. It has better mission structure and a better world (SA has a bigger world and a better setting for a GTA game but it doesn't use it as well as Vice City did).

content:
22, 2011
												This game is an accurate representation of Grandpa's childhood, growing up in the 50's was hard. We didn't have fancy things like watches and roads, we had gravel and pavement and we liked it. There were no black people, because they lived underground and so this game couldn't exist then.I enjoy this game, because it has black people in it, just like my favorite movie Friday. I love when they say ♥♥♥♥♥♥ alot, it reminds me of my father, when I was a kid. Back then dad would take us to what the whites called "♥♥♥♥♥♥ Races" it was where a bunch of black gentlemen would be gathered and your great grandpa would bet on which one would win the race. We never won, but boy were those good memories. Anyways, this game gets a 9.5/10 because it reminds Grandpa of the early days of black rights and privelleges. (Note: Grandpa is very old and of a different time, if you are of african american descent please don't take offense ~ Billy)

content:
r 20, 2014
												===WARNING SPOILERS BELOW DO NOT READ IF YOU DON'T WANT THE PLOT TO BE SPOILED===Grand Thegt Auto is a game developed by ME  at my house in 2006. IT's a flash indie game made with the source engine and it has cross compatability with both lindows and windux. Right off the bat you are thrust into the shoes of Coldsteel the gang banger aka Carl Johntron working for the illuminati fish capers known as CRASH who are corrupt and work to further the secret agenda of single black women everywhere. After a plane crash the preisdent calls in Chill iron to come sell drugs to kids across california so CRASH can operate in secret and save the world from the russian mobsters importing illegal lobsters to suburban housewives in the US. But the game takes a twist when Icemetal the gang banger is thrown in crime for a prison he did not commet. His brother Small Vapor turns out to be working with the russians and you must break out of prison using your streeet knowledge to board a giant airship made of lobsters and kill your brother. Afterwards you are shown a cutscene where your mother turns out to be a lobster and you kill yourself wiht your brothers corpse due to your grief. If you get the bad end then CRASH loses all their funding and the russians ivnade us and the cold war breaks out. There is no good end yet because I haven't got it yet. 7/10

												Ok.this is the second game i bought on Steam after first game i bought it was Flatout 2,in wich im glad i bought it.I dont know why everybody call the Steam version the worst one,problary their PC`s was with Xbox 360 version of the game wich i dont like it too,but i have the same version like the retail one from 2005.Now,let go to story,in wich i found a little stupid but also i like it,Carl Johson (CJ) searching for the guy responsibile for his mother death in wich it was killed in a drive-by by Ballas.SPOILER alert:Now CJ returning home seeing his and his brother gang called Groove Street almost has destroyed by Ballas.He is going to 3 cities:-Los Santos (Los Angeles)-San Fierro (San Francisco)-Las Venturas (Las Vegas)To find out more details about his mother death.He meet new friends and enemies in this 3 cities.Also we meet a character from another GTA,i let you find out this.I wont speak anymore about story because its too long.The gameplay is good for a 2004 game.The guns and the open world are very good.Final note:9/10

content:
, 2016
												This game is fantastic. Although the graphics are a bit outdated, the gameplay is great. The animations for the characters and objects are smooth and flowing. The fire from the flamethrower can be spread on the ground. There are so many things to do, and if you feel like it, activate some cheats, and wreck havok on all of Los Santos with all the weapons you need + all the mods you could ever want. Its also the only GTA game where you can control cranes and trains at any time you want. This game was one of the greatest on PS2 in 2004, and I still think it holds that title. Its kinda like a demake of GTA 5 from my perspective.If you see a copy of this game, go get it and play it! You will have loads of fun!

А ГАНСТЕР ЧЕРНЫЙ!! дадада, ганста черный нигга свег бетч кант! Ну так, вот. Потом все пошло по 3,14зде, в итоге ты опять поднимаешься. Это драматическая история о суровом ганста. Так, что... ДА Я ♥♥♥♥!!! Я НЕ ЗНАЮ ЧЕЛОВЕКА КОТОРЫЙ НЕ ИГРАЛ В ЭТУ ИГРУ!!! Все, всем пока. Подумай о том, что потерял 3 минуты своей жизни ибо я знаю как вы читаете... безграммные бетчи)))

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
y 29, 2016
												Having been a fan of the series since GTA III, and seeing that each game has its own pros and cons (not excluding this one), I have to admit GTA: San Andreas is still my favorite.  The stoyline / voice acting is arguably the best in the series, with no shortage of wacky characters as you'd come to expect from a Rockstar game.  Plently of diverse missions and locations to explore (a massive map for its time) with exellent character customization.I only recently purchased San Andreas on Steam but have sunk countless hours since its intial release on the PS2.  It's definitely worth the price tag for this classic, and a no-brainer if you happen upon it on sale.

, 2015
												First of all , I would like to say that this game is a triple AAA clasic!One of the classic games that everyone should have the opportunity to play !But lets get this review organized:Graphics - 65/100To evaluate the grapics you have to keep on mind that this game is , effectivelly , a game from 2004, so you cannot be expecting to be tremendously beautyfull, it is beautyfull if you compare it to the other games from this especific generation.But one thing I have to admit, I love those beaches! Los Santos <3Sounds- 75/100Oh gosh , how I love to get in a car and live again those 90s musics . One of the things that I did not like about it , is a recent update that took some of my joys off. Copying one guy ----- "Rockstar you a busta! " Story-98/100.PERFECT STORY ! In this game you can live the life of Carl Johnson ( C.J) that came back to his city to assist to his mother funeral. As he gots here , he realizes that his gangsta crew was weak and dying and the others crew like the Ballas were getting better and bigger.He knew that he cannot turn his face around and ignore his familly , so he does a couple things to help the crew. He feels part of the team again and starts to live the thing again. You will be CJ that will try to seek the truth about his mothers death and will try to raise once again the glory of the Groove Street gang.Gameplay- 80/100You have 3 citys - Los Santos , San Fierro , Las Venturas , and 2 "country " zones , the Desert one , and the mountain one .Thats enough ! You have 10000000 things to do!In the end i consider that this game evaluation is 80/100 because it is an analyze from 2015, if this was an analyze from 2004 I would give without any doubt 99/100

content:
ry 10
												G R A N D  T H E F T  A U T O  :  S A N  A N D R E A SAhhh, so much nostalgia playing this game.Even today, the game is still playable, and no I'm not saying it's better than GTA V (only dumb ♥♥♥♥♥ say that.) HOWEVER, this is the game that no one will ever forget it, of how great this is. When I was at 4th grade my friends and classmates would never stop talking about this game. We used to have cheats on a piece of paper, good ol' days. Some homies I know still play it. I never get it finish it though. Right now I am!This is the best, fully gangsta type game ever. GOOD:- So many clothes to wear!- Exercises makes you buffer and stronger, while eating more makes you fatter, neither those will make you skinny. Even GTA IV/V don't have this feature anymore! What happened!? This is so realistic!!- Minigames- Memorable characters- Perfect story- Really long story. Seriously! I thought one more mission then I could finish the game but NOPE I'm still at the 6/7th one! I never completed the game even now!- 8 Major gangs. This so great. You start with Gang Street Families, but unfortunately you cannot be other factions, but it's fun to stay with the story.- That camera that takes pics into real files. I loved that one!- Memorable moments / quotes- Very fun screwing around the lively city of Los Santos.- Story about gangsters/blacks. Nowadays I feel like black people in video games don't care about anything, like Franklin. God, he's so boring. I felt CJ is more funnier and dramatic person he is. BAD:- Updates that removed so many good content and also breaks the mods- Terrible controls. Ever since I was a kid, why the ♥♥♥♥ would anyone bind sprint as SPACE, jump as SHIFT, ENTER to exit menus and SHIFT to open to the next link as default?Final Verdict: The story and gangsta theme is better than GTA V, but it doesn't mean that's bad, I like both games but SA brings memories and many customizations. The first time I played it when I was like 7 or 8, it first came from a computer I bought (some computers have illegal games from the store but that was fun. Always tricked my parents) Now that I'm a young adult, turns out I didn't became a serial killer.  Steam edition: 0/10 > Trash can ♥♥♥♥♥Why bother porting it on Steam when you remove the good things inside it? I will exaggerate by using Hot Coffee patch. ♥♥♥♥ you whoever did this!Actual game: 10/10YOU PICKED THE WRONG REVIEW, FOOL!

er 15, 2014
												GTA SA is one of the best games I have ever played. However, since I love it so much I have created an idol out of it in my life. As a Christian, I am not allowed to play it as I asked myself, "would Christ play this game with me?" So, I put to death that which I love and deny myself since Christ, when he came down to earth, denied himself to do the will of The Father and died for our sins. I challenge my brothers and sisters in Christ to do the same and follow Christ, our forerunner and saviour. Be strong and deny yourself to do His will and not ours. I know it's tough but, when you realize what Christ has done for us and remove yourself (deny oneself) from the throne of your life and allow Christ to sit there. Only then can we truly serve Him. God bless and Godspeed.
